required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Suprachoroidal Injection of Triamcinolone Acetonide With IVT Aflibercept in Subjects With Macular Edema Following RVO
clinical_study.official_title: SAPPHIRE: A Randomized, Masked, Controlled Trial To Study The Safety And Efficacy Of Suprachoroidal CLS-TA In Conjunction With Intravitreal Aflibercept In Subjects With Retinal Vein Occlusion

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 3, multicenter, randomized, masked, controlled, parallel group study of 12 months duration in treatment naïve subjects with RVO.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, masked, controlled trial to study the safety and efficacy of suprachoroidal CLS-TA in conjunction with intravitreal aflibercept in subjects with retinal vein occlusion

clinical_study.why_stopped: Primary, 8-week efficacy endpoint not achieved. No additional benefit for subjects receiving a corticosteroid together with an intravitreal anti-VEGF agent.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Demonstrating ≥ 15 Letter Improvement From Baseline in Early Treatment of Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)
primary_outcome.description: Best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) refers to the measurement of the best possible vision that can be achieved following refraction or correction. BCVA was assessed following the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) protocol and was measured in the number of letters read correctly on an ETDRS eye chart. An increase from the pre-treatment state in BCVA of 15 letters or more represents a clinically meaningful improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity
secondary_outcome.description: Best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) refers to the measurement of the best possible vision that can be achieved following refraction or correction. BCVA was assessed following the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) protocol and was measured in the number of letters read correctly on an ETDRS eye chart. A positive change from baseline value represents an improvement in vision.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Central Subfield Thickness
secondary_outcome.description: Central subfield thickness (CST) is a diagnostic measurement used in identifying the presence of edema in the circular area 1 mm in diameter centered around the fovea. CST was measured using spectral domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT). A masked reading center graded the SD-OCT digital images. A negative change from baseline value represents a reduction in macular edema.

arm_group.description: IVT aflibercept (2 mg/0.05 mL) + CLS-TA (4 mg/100 µL) SC injections
IVT aflibercept (2 mg/0.05 mL) + sham SC procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has a clinical diagnosis of RVO in the study eye
- Has a CST of ≥ 300 µm in the study eye
- Has an ETDRS BCVA score of ≥ 20 letters read and ≤ 70 letters read in the study eye;
- Is naïve to local pharmacologic treatment for RVO in the study eye;
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any active ocular disease or infection in the study eye other than RVO
- History of glaucoma, intraocular pressure > 21 mmHg or ocular hypertension requiring more than one medication
- Any uncontrolled systemic disease that, in the opinion of the Investigator, would preclude participation in the study
- Any evidence of neovascularization in the study eye

measure.title: Proportion of Subjects Demonstrating ≥ 15 Letter Improvement From Baseline in Early Treatment of Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)
measure.description: Best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) refers to the measurement of the best possible vision that can be achieved following refraction or correction. BCVA was assessed following the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) protocol and was measured in the number of letters read correctly on an ETDRS eye chart. An increase from the pre-treatment state in BCVA of 15 letters or more represents a clinically meaningful improvement.
measure.population: The Intent-to-treat population included all randomized subjects who received at least one study treatment.

analysis.groups_desc: Based on a Pearson chi-square test, a total sample size of approximately 460 subjects provided 90% power to detect a difference of 15% between the Active and Control arms assuming the Control arm showed a proportion of 0.50 at 8 weeks. The primary analysis was a test of superiority of the Active arm over the Control arm, and was based on a Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel chi-square test stratified by type of retinal vein occlusion.
analysis.p_value_desc: The a priori threshold for statistical significance was 0.050. Prior to evaluating the results of the CMH test, a Breslow-Day test with Tarone's adjustment was conducted to confirm the homogeneity of the odds ratios between RVO strata.
analysis.method_desc: The CMH test was stratified by the type of retinal vein occlusion, i.e., branch vs. central.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated value was calculated as the percentage of subjects in the Active arm meeting the primary endpoint minus the percentage of subjects in the Control arm meeting the primary endpoint.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity
outcome.description: Best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) refers to the measurement of the best possible vision that can be achieved following refraction or correction. BCVA was assessed following the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) protocol and was measured in the number of letters read correctly on an ETDRS eye chart. A positive change from baseline value represents an improvement in vision.
outcome.population: The Intent-to-treat population included all randomized subjects who received at least one study treatment.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Central Subfield Thickness
outcome.description: Central subfield thickness (CST) is a diagnostic measurement used in identifying the presence of edema in the circular area 1 mm in diameter centered around the fovea. CST was measured using spectral domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT). A masked reading center graded the SD-OCT digital images. A negative change from baseline value represents a reduction in macular edema.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected over 48 weeks of follow-up.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The institutions and Investigators participating in this study shall have no right to publish or present the results of this study without the prior written consent of Clearside Biomedical, Inc.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to the early termination of the trial by sponsor all planned study visits were not completed by all treated subjects; therefore, all planned data was not collected.
